pageContext.claim: “As I said today and many times before, “I have GREAT confidence in MY intelligence people.” However, I also recognize that in order to build a brighter future, we cannot exclusively focus on the past – as the world’s two largest nuclear powers, we must get along! #HELSINKI2018”
pageContext.analysis: At the news conference, Trump said: “[My intelligence chiefs] said they think it’s Russia. I have President Putin; he just said it’s not Russia. I will say this: I don’t see any reason why it would be.” In other words, he expressed confidence in them but then doubted their conclusions, favoring what the Russian president told him.
